question: In Young's double slit experiment, an electron beam is used to produce interference fringes of width β₁. Now the electron beam is replaced by a beam of protons with the same experimental set-up and same speed. The fringe width obtained is β₂. The correct relation between β₁ and β₂ is
explanation: Mass of proton > Mass of electron. For same speed, λ_proton < λ_electron.
Therefore, β₂ (proton) < β₁ (electron), or β₁ > β₂.
